    Topic Modelling with Bertopic

    fit a bertopic model to cleaned data

    fit_transform_model.Rd

    fit a bertopic model to cleaned data

    Usage

    fit_transform_model(
cleaned_text,
calculated_embeddings = NULL,
min_topic_size = 10,
nr_topics = NULL,
ngram_range = tuple(1,1),
embedding_model = "all-MiniLM-L6-v2",
accelerator = "mps",
diversity = 0.1,
stopwords = TRUE,
random_state = NULL)

    Arguments

    cleaned_text

    cleaned text column that the model should be fit with

    calculated_embeddings

    if embeddings are already calculated input embeddings as matrix

    min_topic_size

    minimum topic size

    nr_topics

    the number of topics to find within the dataset

    ngram_range

    ngram range for topic representation - input must be of type tuple: use the reticulate function reticulate::tuple()

    embedding_model

    which embedding model to use or was used to produce embeddings

    accelerator

    accelerator to use - default is mps, use NULL if none

    diversity

    diversity of topic representation (1 = diverse, 0 = not diverse)

    stopwords

    whether or not to remove stopwords in topic representations

    random_state

    random state to pass to umap

    Value

    list containing fitted bertopic model and embeddings used to fit the model
